captions.text:
- I know that Nick--
she's sick, right?
- She's sick today, yes.

- Wow.
- Yeah.

- Flying and she got, like--
- Yeah, she kind of--

Yeah, she just took on
a little too much,

as she's prone to do
sometimes.

She's just a bit
under the weather today.

- Yeah, you both are really,
really hard workers.

- We are,
and every now and then,

it just sort of catches up
with us.

You can relate, right?
- Yeah, yeah.

And, well, your body is saying,
"Hey, slow down."

It's kind
of your body's way to--

'cause if you're not gonna stop,
it'll tell you.

- Yeah, exactly.
- Yeah.

So Nick was here
not too long ago

and shared the loss
of her dad,

and she was so eloquent,
the way she spoke about it.

And I know
it was a loss for you,

and this was the first holiday
without him.

So that must've been--
- It was.

We had Nick mom's come over
for Christmas
in Nashville with us,

and it was beautiful
to have her with us,

and just to be together
as a family
was really nice.

- She--I mean, I know how much
y'all love each other.

Backstage,
the way you look at each other,

it's like you can see when
people are just madly in love.

And this is her talking about
you last time she was here.
- Oh.

- He has been so good to me,
you know, for nine years,

but for the last sort of month,
which has been

a really tough time for me,
to have--

when you have your partner
who just literally carries you

through a tough time--
oh--
and he's been amazing to me.
I recently lost my father,

and to have my husband be--
just step up,

you know, in that way,
it makes me cry.
He's amazing.
[cheers and applause]

- Good couple.
You're a good couple.

- Family's everything.
- Yeah.

- It is.
It is.

So one of the songs
you're nominated for is
"Raise 'Em Up," right?
- Yes, it's the single.

- I know you don't have a band
with you,

but because
it's my birthday

and I just--
I want to hear the song,

I brought a guitar
that maybe you'd want to play,

and I thought you would
want to do that

'cause your name
is on the stuff.

- I know that guitar.
- Yeah.
[cheers and applause]
- Okay.

I wish I had Eric here.
He'd play with me.

He'd sing with me,
wouldn't--
[playing soft guitar music]

[singing]
Raise 'em up

I'm talking about a lighter
on a Saturday night

The band plays a song
you like
And you sing along
Raise 'em up

I'm talking about
Daddy's old pickup truck

Shotgun seat,
there's the one you love
And you're kissing on

Get those white sails
sailing down in Mexico

It's just a whiskey glass
if you ain't making a toast

Lift your tear-filled eyes
up to the sky

A-coming home,
you've been gone too long

Tonight we're gonna
raise 'em up
Happy birthday
To you

Happy birthday
to you
I like your socks, Ellen.

[singing]
Happy birthday
Dear Ellen
Happy birthday
To you
[cheers and applause]
- Thank you so much.

New Zealand born.. Moved to Australia at a early age 3 or 4 I think.. like 
most smart New Zealanders do because thay have to work for peanuts there.. 
Had amazing talent, Australia had no idea Because like most Australians 
sometimes thay become like emus and have there head berried in the sand and 
don't know when talent hits them in the face. And then there was America 
thank god for America because for some reason thay never let the good ones 
slip away. 
Love from the land down under. .﻿
